meanings.sent1: The city was urbanising rapidly, with new buildings popping up everywhere.
meanings.sent2: The town council is urbanising the downtown area to attract more businesses.
meanings.sent3: The suburbs were urbanising so quickly that even the squirrels seemed surprised.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were urbanising the traditional approach to city planning.
meanings.sent5: The urbanising of the neighborhood brought a vibrant energy to the community.

meanings.definition: The process of developing urban areas.
meanings.sent1: Urbanising requires careful planning and consideration of community needs.
meanings.sent2: The urbanising of the city led to improved infrastructure and services.
meanings.sent3: The urbanising of the old factory district turned it into a trendy hotspot.
meanings.sent4: The urbanising of the waterfront transformed it into a bustling hub of activity.
meanings.sent5: The urbanising of the suburbs brought a mix of excitement and challenges to the residents.
